Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: First time stay at the hotel (04/2012) and really enjoyed the stay. Room was very nice - including a full kitchen (didn't expect that) along with free breakfast. Park on the same level as your room if you have a lot of luggage making it very convenient to get to your car. Very helpful front desk staff who assisted me with incoming Fedex package. Warning: Arrive to breakfast early - it can get a bit crazy if you go later in the morning (I'd say the rule would be: get there before 800a). Tried to upload photos but when I click on next - nothing happens. Will see if I can edit this review after I post it and add some photos.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: Everytime we go to Dallas for NCA's, we stay at this hotel. I love the breakfast and the beds are comfortable. The space in the room is excellent and if you get two Kings, It's even better. You cannot go wrong with this one. The only small caveat is that it is quite costly to park, but there is a shuttle that will take you within a 3 mile radius. Even though the hotel was busy that weekend, we didn't have any trouble catching the shuttle when we needed to.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service will definitely bring me back”
Reviews.Author: swtp232
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great price for the location. The staff was AMAZING and gave us complimentary parking just because we had to wait about 5 minutes in line to check in. Cocktail hour in the evenings was a nice touch. The room was clean and well appointed. I appreciated the small kitchenette. Bathroom was too small and a bit dated. Overall had a great stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: monmouthprof
Reviews.Content: Middle of the road hotel. Great chain, excellent service, but a bit dated as a true Hyatt hotel. Rooms could use some work... Mold in shower corners, and random dust throughout. Food was a pleasant surprise for the morning and evening snack. Staff was very knowledgeable and highly efficient. But does this meet Hyatt standards...

Reviews.Title: “Such promise, but not quite”
Reviews.Author: Mainecowboy
Reviews.Content: Location is good downtown and close to American Airlines arena. The AM breakfast is over average. Parking secured. Cool, non-standard room layouts and good amendities. BUT, fitness room a disappointment, phones were a PITA to use AND had nasty ketchup on the chord, and Bathroom was small.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: kabrenee
Reviews.Content: We found the Hyatt Suites to be just perfect. The front desk staff was wonderful, even remembered our names, helped us with their free shuttle service and was always friendly. The room was clean and had all amenities. The location is also close to downtown and an easy walk to the American Arena. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: volleyballtennisski
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and clean. The layout, decor and furniture are comfortable. The photos are accurate. The bed was perfect. Very firm mattress. There is a shuttle driver who will take you anywhere within 15 minutes of the hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. Rates were good on Expedia. That said, I'll probably stay somewhere else in Dallas next time in order to explore some of the other neighborhoods. I like to walk in cities, and this part of the city really isn't pedestrian friendly. Frankly, I didn't see many areas in the downtown area that would be fun to stroll around, but I'll look harder next time. If this is close to where you need to visit, then definitely give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - very convient location”
Reviews.Author: TLD2006
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the hotel and staff, the location was great as long as you didn't have to walk. But centrally located within a mile of most things. The breakfast was average, rooms are nice - covered parking was great as a rain storm blew thru the 2nd and 3rd night I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “SMU Graduation”
Reviews.Author: eighthnote
Reviews.Content: We had an opportunity to stay at this location for four nights while in Dallas for a recent SMU graduation. We found this location to be quite lovely, while still obviously in the process of renovation. In fact, new wallpaper was being installed on our hall while we were there. The complimentary breakfast was very nice, with many hot and cold choices. Our experiences with the staff were good on the three occasions we needed their help. Though costing $18/day, the parking is gated, and the entries from the parking lot are all secure. We enjoyed the small shopping with grocery store nearby. With our kitchen, we were able to prepare small meals in our room. There are two things that need improvement to our way of thinking. Number one, the shower head flows so freely that the water stands in the tub above one's ankles. Number two, there wasn't a dresser in our bedroom with the only clothes storage being a small wardrobe in the closet. There was only one suitcase stand, so we asked for an extra one, which helped.

Reviews.Title: “Awful noisy stay!”
Reviews.Author: cindysk
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here to visit some colleges. Our room was on the busy Harry Hines Blvd. very noisy, cars, but on the weekend also people outside, til 4am. The suite was updated and spacious but this did not make up for the other cons. The people running the front desk are young and did not give accurate information. The complimenatary shuttle was often unavailable and only runs til 7 pm on the weekends, really not that helpful it only takes you within a 2 mile radius of the hotel. Breakfast was suppose to be included....we stayed 3 nights, out of that only could find food for breakfast 1 morning the other mornings they were all out by 9am, suppose to to be til 10am. Housekeeping did not make up our room 2 days, even though we did complain to the front desk, it did not make a difference. Taxi fares in Dallas are expensive and the cabbies try and rip you off with extra person, and toll fees...never could figure out their system..so beware. The hotel does charge a 12/night parking fee. Wi Fii was sporadic at best....although free...could not use it most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: peachberry7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at this property to avoid a long drive home after a concert at the American Airlines Center. We were happy with the location as it was within walking distance so we could avoid crazy traffic and outrageous parking prices at the venue. No complaints from us about the $12 parking fee at the hotel. We utilized the shuttle service going and then just walked back. It's not far by any means, but at such a late hour, just play it safe! We missed the evening social and room service already ended, so it was nice to learn that a few restaurants still delivered at such late hours! Menus are provided at the front desk. We opted for Chinese and our food arrived in like 15 minutes! It was the fasted delivery I've ever encountered. Anywho, no complaints about the room or the property in general. The front desk clerks were extremely friendly and helpful!! Oh, and we're not breakfast people, but scoped out the spread and it had eggs, waffles, bacon, cereal, bagels, etc etc. I get that people have different experiences when staying at hotels... our stay here was excellent. Some people are just overly picky hence the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay near downtown”
Reviews.Author: DCMatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights on business when there were no "per diem" rooms available at my usual hotels in Dallas. I was pleasantly surprised. I really liked the free shuttle to take me downtown. Happy hour was decent. Breakfast was very nice. Room was comfortable, quiet, and clean. The efficiency style room with kitchenette would be great for extended stays. I'll be going back on my next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal here”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller2576
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days at the beginning of a 25 day across USA trip. after a long 15 hour flight we found the hotel quite easily and found after a few days the location to be quite central and convenient. Hotel staff friendly and helpful on arrival and our suite was spacious, clean and had ample facilities...eg: fridge, microwave, free internet access, free parking, free breakfast every day and. a clean laundry room. Add to this a quite inexpensive rate and its a great deal for travellers. The furniture is older and decor a bit old fashioned but very clean, and bathroom facilities were totally adequate, and we are a bit fussy.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back yet again! =)”
Reviews.Author: GothicblueCJ
Reviews.Content: My friend & I booked this hotel to be close to Downtown Dallas. After I had booked, I had realized that I had stayed here back in 2003.(BTW-This is a VERY convenient location if you are attending a show at the American Airlines Arena!). So needless to say, it has been upgraded since my last stay. There is a $24 per day charge for parking and it is secure in the connecting parking garage. They processed our requests accordingly- we had asked for extra pillows & a room near the elevator! I booked a King bedroom with sofa sleeper. The room was clean, quite, & comfortable. The only snafu we had was that the corded phone was having issues. We used the cordless phone to call the front desk and a serviceman was sent up. He was efficient and got the phones up and running in no time. The staff was great. When we checked in, we were greeted by Mark. He gave us dinner recommendations for the night. He had a very pleasant and positive attitude-he's an asset to the company. The 2 ladies at check-out were also very friendly! I would come back here again! Thanks for the nice stay! =)

Reviews.Title: “A perfect pick!”
Reviews.Author: Urbanherb
Reviews.Content: After a 4 nite stay, my family was very happy with the staff (yes Grace is a doll) and the facilities. We felt safe and welcome by all that were working at this well appointed hotel. We loved having the kitchen and the pool. It is close to great restaurants and shopping. Breakfasts were fresh. Public spaces were clean. We would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be back”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding in downtown Dallas so we used Hyatt points for two nights in this hotel. I love Hyatts and have enjoyed the new brands, so I didn't think twice about it. Despite very the very cheery and polite front desk staff of Shelby and Grace, I won't be back. Problems: -Our room wasn't made up after the first morning of our stay. We got back to the room at 4pm and it was too late as housekeeping left for the day. -Of the 5 machines in the gym, only 1 worked properly. They don't maintain the equipment (no service plan) so it's no shock. It was quite amusing to see the manager try to make the treadmill belt move by pushing it thinking it would all of a sudden get working. He definitely wasn't the friendliest person I've met in a hotel. -They have flat screen TVs in all rooms, but with a very oversplit analog cable service, it looks like the cable in my fraternity house 20 years ago - fuzzy at best, and definitely not fitting the HDTVs. -Two of the lights in my bathroom were out - housekeeping didn't tell maintenance to fix. -They did a nice job with the carpeting and floor in the living room/kitchen, but for some reason the rubber strip that connects the two had gaps in it. -Rusty exhaust vent covers in the bathroom. -Very noisy a/c in the room. -Very dirty windows (not that there's a view of anything worth looking at). -$12/day for parking. Seriously? That's just plain greedy for a business hotel like this. -Horrible bandwidth. It's provisioned down to 0.5MB. After 30 minutes on the phone with tech support on Saturday morning at 7:30am, he took the filters off my MAC address and got me 3MB. 0.5MB is so 1999 and won't support modern VPN connections. -The cabinets in the bathroom and kitchen used to be some sort of wood grain, but instead of replacing or refacing them, they merely painted them some sort of dull brown color which is a stark contrast to the stainless steel appliance (in the kitchen). One of the cabinet doors in the kitchen was pretty crooked too, making it look worse. The only other positive was the bed. Thankfully they have the wonderful Hyatt beds so at least we slept. They got so many of the little details so badly wrong that if I need to be in the area again, I will be sure to choose one of the many other options that exist.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: MrsStretch
Reviews.Content: VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE . . . We reserved 4 hotel suites for the Women of Faith Conference at the American Airlines Center back in May 2011. The conference was in August 2011, and we called the week before to confirm everything about our rooms. When we got there the lobby was crowded with women from around the US trying to get checked into their rooms. When it was our group leader's turn, the front desk manager informed her that they had doubled booked our rooms, and the other guests had already arrived. We found out that this had happened to several other women too. The hotel ended up booking us another hotel and they paid for it which was nice, and they really had no choice because our group leader was furious! We ended up 30 minutes from where we needed to be with no restaurants near us within walking distance. We had to depend on the shuttle service from the hotel that messed up the reservations instead of the one they took us to. It really made it hard getting back and forth to where we needed to be all weekend. The hotel General Manager, Jeff Jones gave us each a gift certificate for a two day stay at another time for up to a year. We have to call and book the room and mention the gift certificate and give the voucher number when we make the reservation. The certificate isn't good for holidays or black out days, standard policy, no problem; right! I call for the weekend of September 10th-11th to use my two days for my daughter and her husband for my daughter's 25th birthday. I tell the front desk who I am, and the lady says that I have to talk to Mr. Jones myself. She puts me through, and I get his voice mail. I leave a message and five hours later the front desk lady that I talked to earlier calls me back. She states that the GM is busy and asked her to relay a message to me that they are all booked up and that weekend is a "blackout" date. I asked her about another weekend, and she says that they are booked for the next few weeks. They have one night available on September 24th. I told her that wasn't a good weekend for us. She said that I could call back in October and try to book another date and time. But I would have to call and see when the black out dates are because they change every month. She stated that they are really busy during the holidays and that I would need to call as soon as possible in order to see if I can use my certificate then. Needless to say, I was upset again, some hotel this is turning out to be! I looked up the hotel reservation line's number and called. I told the lady that I was looking for a suite for this weekend, the 10th - 11th. She said no problem we have several different suites to choose from. She asked if I had a preference, and I told her no. I also asked her that I had some friends that were looking for rooms as well, and that I would need to book four more rooms. She said that isn't a problem, but they might not be side by side. I said that was fine, and asked her again that you have several rooms available, and she said yes. Then I told the lady that I had called the hotel itself and asked about making a reservation, and that I was told the hotel was completely sold out. The lady said well, I don't understand, there must have been a cancellation since you called. I told her that I would get back to her about the reservation and hung up. It makes me wonder if I will ever use this voucher, and I wonder why the GM was lying to me. He didn't even have the courtesy to call me himself. I don't know why I would even want to stay here, much less recommend it to a friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: “Say here you won't be dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Lostpiper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to get to from Interstate 35 North . It was clean ,staff were friendly , the room was excellent . I loved the secure garage for my car . The hotel while close to downtown was very quiet with no airport or traffic noise . I will say here again on my next trip to Dallas .

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenities and Staff”
Reviews.Author: todd f
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in the Summerfield Suites for a week while my wife and I were working in Dallas. The staff were exceptionally welcoming. Room was a nice 1 bedroom, and even the sofa bed was comfortable, if thats possible. Free breakfast and light dinner made it convenient. As did the walk to restaraunts and access to the trolly on McKinney. $12 a day for parking. The kids swam in the pool a couple times a day. My duaghter wants us to stay here on our return trip as well, because of how kind Grace at the front desk was to her each day.

Reviews.Title: “Go meet Grace!”
Reviews.Author: raquelle00
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt delivered exactly as Hyatt brand has that great tendency to: spotless, huge rooms with comfy sofa, great beds, spotlessly clean everywhere! We had a king studio which had it's own kitchen and even a walk in wardrobe- which after 2 weeks on the road were an absolute joy!!! The manager obviously keeps a tight ship here and we really loved our stay. The fitness centre was great with really good machines which allowed us to keep up marathon training despite the insane heat! But what made our stay a really happy one was the staff who proved that first class service does not have to be stuffy and characterless! Grace the front desk girl just makes everyone's day that much brighter with her sunny disposition and just obvious enjoyment of her job. She makes you feel as though you really have a friend as soon as you land. She really is a diamond in the hospitality world! All in all a great stop off on Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice residence inn--Could we have some REAL EGGS?”
Reviews.Author: giorgio11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel/residence inn countless times over the last six years (probably about 450 nights all told) working for a Dallas-based client. The hotel was remodeled and given a much-needed facelift in 2006. All of the rooms have a kitchenette with basic cooking utensils, full-size fridge, microwave but no oven, and two-burner stove. Many of the rooms have a separate bedroom (don't know what they call that) with a little dressing room area separate from the bathroom. The regular rooms have a bedroom separated from the living room by a divider/storage shelf unit with drawers and housing a flat-screen TV (DVD players included, no BluRay). The rooms facing west onto Harry Hines can get really hot in the summer, so I leave the drapes closed. Those are also the noisiest rooms, and the traffic noise even late at night can awaken a light sleeper. There is breakfast every day starting at 6 a.m. (7 on Sat.-Sun.) with Starbuck's coffee, fruit, cereal, those horrible fake homogenized eggs (Guys, there are 10 million chickens within 100 miles of Dallas; can you not do some REAL EGGS?), usually limp bacon or near-ham, potatoes or waffles, it's all edible if not exactly awe-inspiring. There is also a "social hour" from 5:30-7 pm Mon.-Thurs., with beer, wine, fruit, salad, cheese, cold cuts, soup, and usually a choice of hot bar items such as hot wings, pizza, nachos, and that horrible salty spinach-asparagus cheese dip (who eats that stuff?). Again, some nights you can make a meal, other nights are worth skipping. But the beds are super-comfortable, and the cleanliness is OK if not great (I can't stand to go barefoot in the room, always socks or flip-flops), and having a kitchen in the room makes my long business stays tolerable. There is a decent Kroger over on Cedar Springs in the gay neighborhood, or for more upscale you can go to Whole Foods on Lemmon. Lots of restaurants in the area worth trying, too many to name, but my faves are Herrera's for Mexican, on Maple, Truluck's, pricy on McKinney, and the cozy La Madeleine on Lemmon for an occasional French breakfast or crepe. One other gripe, however. Despite being a Diamond Platinum Hyatt member, the turnover at this hotel is so high that nobody knows my name. So some of the most competent and friendly people are always disappearing, in favor of folks who are neither especially friendly and some quite incompetent. Always ask for the name of who is helping you, and then make sure they really did.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: brian6743
Reviews.Content: First, it's run down. Second, its managed by scoobee dooo. They treat their guests like dogs. For example tonite the power was out for over four hours. When I asked them what I should do they acted like it was not 9 pm and 105 degrees out.....I know it's not the Ritz but come on! The parking garbage is a death trap. Twice I drove in and my key would not work and I was trapped in the garage. So when the power goes out what to they hand out? Water? Food?fans? Nothing but chem lights because the place did not even have emergency lights or working fire alarms!!!! The breakfast had flies in the food. Sorry I'm not that hungry. The pool had poop floating in it and when I told the front desk they told me to swim around it and someone would clean it the next day. Do yourself a favor and save your money. This place should be shut down or at least used as the Dallas county jail. I can't make this stuff up. I'm a hyatt diamond member and planned to stay at this hotel for three months. No way. I'd rather be in jail or sleep in the park.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Ben_from_Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: I've been trying to stay at the Summerfield Suites for months, but every time I've tried it's been booked--and now I know why. It's not that the hotel is super luxurious (though my suite had two flat-screen TVs) or stands out in one particular area. This hotel just does a great job at making everything easy and convenient, it's in a great location, and it has all the right features for the business traveler--not to say I wouldn't stay here with my wife or even with a family. I think I was given an upgrade over the standard suite, but my room was quite big. It had a spacious living room I barely used, a big bathroom, and a kitchenette with two electric burners, a good sized refrigerator, coffee maker, and dishwasher. Free breakfast every morning was great and saved a bunch of time. My only, and very small, complaint is that the fitness center is pretty limited: some free weights and a few cardio machines. However, it was good enough for me. Some people may have been turned off by an A/C unit housed behind a cabinet door under the TV in the bedroom, but I don't mind white noise when I go to sleep, so it wasn't an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and confortable.”
Reviews.Author: KitDesign
Reviews.Content: Clean, Clean and did I say Clean! If you are like me this is the most important thing in a hotel and the Hyatt exceeded my expectations! The staff is friendly and helpful. Parking was great inside their own garage.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we were thinking”
Reviews.Author: EERO42
Reviews.Content: I run Dallasmarathon , wich we do twice per year over the world. We ( me and wife ) have travelled over 40 countries . We took this 3stars hotel, it is better than three. Good service , helpful management,great breakfest and predinner snacks training tools in the hotel and running route outside gave good start for the marathon. Excellent parkinghouse in the hotel, easy in driving. if we must say something not-good, it is AC.machines voice, but it is some in the every hotel, which have those.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave the room.”
Reviews.Author: roneilltx
Reviews.Content: "WOW" was what came out of my mouth when I entered the room. It was very stylish for an extended stay room. The couch is amazing and the bed was wonderful to sleep in. Bathroom was adequate in size and the kitchen was very nice! The free breakfast was much better than those "continental" breakfasts. I had scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, and pancakes. A big thing for me is air conditioning in hotel and I was able to keep my room cold at night so I could sleep well. The only negative is that the hotel is a little difficult to get to and the parking is not free like someone previously reported. I love this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EeFVerona
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dallas just for one night; the hotel is very confortable, clean and with free wi-fi and parking. The check-in and check-out was quick and the receptionist very kind. In our room there was a very nice kitchen. Good location near everything! Good price for value! (The little shop inside the hotel is very expensive)

Reviews.Title: “ALLERGY SUFFERERS BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lots0Travel
Reviews.Content: I am extremely allergic to the down feather pillows that many hotels have. I booked this hotel needing a good night's sleep, as I have a $2000 3-hour examination I am taking the next day. I called ahead and requested that they put non-feather pillows in my room, and they said OK. When I arrived, my request was not taken care of, and they said "I'm sorry, there's nothing we can do." This is not the first time that a Hyatt Hotel has done this to me. I also stayed at a Hyatt in Albuquerque, and the exact same thing happened. It appears that Hyatt misleads you to get you to book the hotel. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! I have stayed in many, many hotels over the past several years, and the Hyatt has consistently disappointed in this regard. I have not had the same problems with other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: daffydana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a couple of nights and enjoyed this hotel. The room was nice. Not perfect but a good value. We enjoyed having the kitchenette and the sitting area. Nice tv. I was happy with the spacious, clean room. No complaints to think of. The breakfast was welcome. We arrived a little late but the lady who was putting away the food brought a few things back for us on a cart and helped us to find silverware, etc. What makes this hotel really stand out is the desk staff. Everyone was very friendly. I wasn't made to feel, at any time, that I was a bother and that if I needed anything, all I had to do was ask. Thanks again, Daniela, Elisia and Candace. Your boss should give you a raise. You are all definitely assets to the hotel. I have very little tolerance for poor service or with people, in the customer service industry, who don't do their jobs well. Another thing I would like to add is the hotel feels secure and the area seems safe. Room keys are needed to enter the parking garage and the doors into the hotel. Except, of course, the front door. A GPS was left in my truck and I accidentally left the window down and came back to find it was still there. I wouldn't recommend doing this to anyone but was happy that it wasn't stolen. I'm sure it helped that the garage was secure. If you want luxury and are prepared to pay for it, don't stay here. If you want a nice room with a great location at a moderate price, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: Neponset
Reviews.Content: Secured a very good rate for a three night stay through Hotwire. Upon arrival, my initial impressions were not favorable. I was told that my reservation did not qualify me for a kiing bed. The initial room smelled of smoke. There was no drawer space for clothing. In the end, though, I left with a favorable impression. Good business center. Free wireless internet. Nice pool with adjacent lounge area. Pretty good breakfast and nice evening refreshments. Probably the most noteworthy is the staff. Everyone was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: firewoody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt last night. Had a great stay. Room was priced great. It was under $100 for a one bedroom suite! Don't order from the menu in the room. Extremely overpriced. It's a third party company that acts as room service. We got two orders of southwest egg rolls and a order of stuffed jalapeÃ±os =$40. Parking was very good. Secure garage. Very close to the medical district and the american airline center. We would stay here again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: mntrojan
Reviews.Content: I'd highly recommend this hotel. Great location, secure parking, clean, modern rooms, very helpful employees, free shuttle, near all of the best restaurants and bars. I travel around the world and usually stay at the "high-rise" hotels but I would take a hotel like this over any of them - anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for events at AA Center”
Reviews.Author: winags
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend the Black Eyed Peas concert with friends. We stayed free with our Hyatt points. The covered, gated parking was very nice. The room was ok, nothing fancy, which was fine. It is across the street from the parking for the American Airlines Center. You could probably walk there, but I wouldn't. It was very easy for my friends to drop me off there after the concert though. This is not a luxury hotel, but is fine for a stay to attend an event, or for business.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: VLF
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend here during the Bon Jovi concert. The room itself was very nice with a fully equipped kitchen, nice bedroom/bath, and a comfortable living area. The location was wonderful. We were able to walk to the American Airlines Center for the concert as it was only 1/4 mile away. We felt perfectly safe walking back to the hotel after the concert, even at 11:30 at night. The staff was very friendly and helpful, too. We didn't eat the free breakfast but it smelled good. Really pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Close to American Airlines Arena”
Reviews.Author: BCRoadie
Reviews.Content: I travelled here in April 2010 mainly because it was a 10 minute walk to the arena as we were headed to a Stars game. The continental breakfast was upscale and they had a free happy hour with chicken, guacamole, chip and salsa, beer, wine etc. Booking here really saved the food bill. This hotel is also close to the freeway (not that you can hear though) and very close to downtown Dallas. The staff was freindly, the hotel clean, parking was secure (and $6.00 per day). Being from Canada, the type of beds were abit odd, they dont have a room with two queens, we stayed in one with a king and csofa sleeper, Perhaps they just werent avaialble at the price we booked at. I would reccomend this property highly, also we were told that many families of Satrs and Mavericks players stay here so it cant be bad, right?

Reviews.Title: “Third-class hotel, not worth staying there”
Reviews.Author: Ron123Tucson
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this Hyatt-branded hotel. The furnishings were dated and dirty, some furniture was broken, the carpet needed cleaning, etc. It is in dire need of updating and upgrading to be competitive in the Dallas market. It appears that the owners have done little or nothing to modernize the place. Hyatt should take its name off the place--it's more like a low-end Ramada Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - cleaning was poor though”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Tripper29
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious rooms and good location, however the daily cleaning service was poor. In the 6 nights we stayed here the toilet and bath were never cleaned, units look rarely ever dusted and shampoo and toilet roll were not replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay - especially for visting the American Airlines Center”
Reviews.Author: stuartrobing
Reviews.Content: We chose the the Hyatt Summerfield because of it's close proximity to the American Airlines Center and its price. I would highly recommend staying here and will be staying here the next time I come to an event at the American Airlines Center. The room was large with a walk in closet and comfortable bed. I slept in but my wife enjoyed the complimentary breakfast the morning we were there. We had just a 5-7 minute easy walk to and from the arena from the hotel and felt safe even when the event ended at 11:30pm. The parking was $6/day but considering was worth it as I didn't have to park at the event (Parking was $20 at the event). The parking was also secure, required card access for entry and the gates would not allow anyone to walk in unless they had a card. You could also park on the floor of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Homey, and in a Wonderfully uptown/downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: MooMooStreet
Reviews.Content: My suite was very roomy and reminded me of home â€“ very CLEAN! There was a full kitchen, contemporary dÃ©cor and a convenient schedule on the fridge for a good little reminder of when certain events were to take place. Not to mention, the hotel has a great location basically next door to American Airlines Center, where the Mavs and Stars play (as the front desk told me), as well as where many big-name concerts take place. Make sure to keep that in mind when checking into this hotel. See what is going on next door. Uptown seems very trendy and fun, so if you have any extra time, hit up a local bar, etc. Missed out on that some, but now Iâ€™m gone so Iâ€™m telling all of you. If you are going to go to Dallas, this has the ideal location. Beautiful pool area with lounge chairs and trees, as well as all the amenities needed to stay longer (fitness center, laundry room, etc). It is in a busy area though, so beware.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room. Large and Well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: ladydanger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend while I was in Dallas to catch the King Tut exhibit at the Dallas Museum of Art before the exhibit went to its next destination. I had never stayed at a Hyatt Summerfield before, and was pretty impressed by the quality of the rooms. I stayed in a King Studio Suite which meant everything but the bathroom and closet were in one space, but the layout of the room did a good job separating the living room, kitchen and bedroom areas. The living room had a flat screen television and a DVD/CD player, a nice spacious desk and a comfortable couch. The kitchenette was a good size for a hotel room. Not large, but certainly not cramped. The only thing it was missing was an oven, which I might miss if I was staying here for an extended period, but for a quick weekend the 2 burner stove, microwave, dishwasher, sink, and full fridge and freezer were more than enough for my needs. I never had to use it, but I noticed the hotel had dishwashing liquid beneath the sink, and the drawers and cupboards were equipped with a small selection of pretty much everything one would need for the kitchen. There was even a wine corkscrew and a pasta strainer. The bathroom was a little small, but not too bad. The provided toiletries are of good quality and I was very impressed with the water pressure in the shower. It's better than I have at home! My only complaint about the comfort of the room is that the mattress is a bit harder than I care for. It wasn't terrible, but I felt a bit stiff in the morning. The bedding was high quality though, plenty of pillows and blankets that are better than your average hotel's. The facilities here were very nice as well. I didn't stay long enough to make use of the pool (wasn't really warm enough anyway), business center, or the fitness area, but the free wi-fi was really easy to access and was pretty fast. I was also comforted by the security of the hotel's parking garage. I was traveling by myself so safety is a concern, but the small parking garage was gated and required room key access, was well lit, and you could park on the same floor as your room, with the doors from the parking garage opening straight into the hotel's hallway so there wasn't a long walk from your car to the lobby and then up to your room. The door between the garage and the hotel required your room key again so there was a second level of security. This made things feel safe as well as convenient. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Everything was nice and clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I'm not sure if I would return to this particular hotel as I tend to get hopelessly lost when forced to drive around downtown Dallas (I got lost on the way back to the hotel both nights of my stay), but I will definitely check out other locations for this chain in the future. It was a really good value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, easy walk to to AA Center”
Reviews.Author: alyson003
Reviews.Content: I got a very reasonable rate and stayed here for a concert that was at the American Airlines Center. It was only about a 5 minute walk there so it fit my needs perfectly. The room was super clean with 2 flat screen tvs. I had a suite with a full size kitchen. Bathroom was a bit dated, but bed was very comforable. There was a shuttle to take you other places downtown, but I didn't use it. They have a snack/deli store that is open 24 hours. I would definitely stay here again if going to the aa center. I think this hotel is a great value vs the W right next to the center. The walk is a bit further but price is nearly half. Getting to the hotel was a little confusing when we got of the interstate, but we found it fairly quickly. They also have a free parking garage and intenet access as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Moderate Ammenities, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: texas_aquaholic
Reviews.Content: We stayed One night for a wedding which was close to this area. Booked online through a travel site and got a decent rate, called ahead and spoke with the conciere about a shuttle service for my arrival. She informed me I would sign up upon arrival but shouldn't run into any problems. We checked in, and were immediately informed the shuttle only runs on weekdays. Unfortunate, so we asked the front desk to have a cab available in an hour and a half. When we came to the lobby for the cab, to our dismay it was pulling out with another couple. We waited another 15 minutes and were almost late to the wedding. Other than that, plenty of parking, the room was nice and very modern with flat screens, but we didn't stay in it very long. There's not much shopping really in walking distance, or restaurants/bars. For the money, I would stay somewhere closer to McKinney like ZaZa with a restaurant/bar in the facility.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME--highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: interviewqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights as I interviewed at the Parkland and Baylor Dallas hospitals. The location was a bit tricky to find even with GPS. However, once I was there, i was not disappointed. The hotel is in the heart of downtown, right next to the AA center.Check in service by the staff was excellent. In fact, every time I walked by, they were attentive and ready to answer any questions I had. I stayed in an executive king. One bed, one pull out sofa, mini kitchen. The furniture was new and clean and had a modern look to it. There was wifi and a flat screen tv in my room. The bed was nice, high, comfy, with down comforter. Everything you would need in the mini kitchen, including pots/pans, utensils provided. It was amazing. I went to the newly renovated fitness center and I thought it didn't have a tv at first but then I realized that the tvs were on the equipment! You just hook in your headphones and you're good to go. there is a treadmill, elipitcal and a bike. Some free weights too. They may be adding more since they were still renovating. I found out that they were changing from the Bradford to the Hyatt during my stay. This did not impact me at all. In fact, I thought I got a bargain for the price I paid. The food was also very good. There is complimentary breakfast everyday with starbucks coffee. There is warm bar, bread, bagels, fruit, yogurt and coffee/tea. Everything was great. Overall, this hotel was fabulous. I didn't mind paying an extra 15 dollars/night compared to the other hotels that were offered to me for my interviews because the service and quallity can't be beat. I highly recommend this hotel. (may now be called the hyatt). The shuttle service will take you anywhere within a 3 mile

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: eyeamhiphopssole
Reviews.Content: Room was recently renovated. Has a large flat screen TV, DVD player, plently of room on the desk for your laptop etc. Very secure parking garage. The free breakfast was okay. Definitely would stay again due to the nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for our puposes”
Reviews.Author: JanM59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bradford for a week last June on my first trip to Dallas. The suite had everything we needed. The continental breakfast was average. The rooms were clean. The only problem was that I got billed for a couple of phone calls made directly from the room that I know we didn't make because we all have cell phones. (Probably the maid needed to make the calls.) The location was great for us! Not right in the center of things but we were able to walk to downtown and also to pick up the McKinney Ave. Trolley. The parking was fantastic, with the key entry covered garage where you can park right on the floor of your room. I had no need for restaurants nearby because I was visiting my boyfriend's hometown & family while there, so he took me all over. I think it would be a great place to stay for events at the American Airlines Center or Victory Plaza, which by the way, had not been built yet when I was there. The pool area in the middle of the courtyard was nice, the workout room left something to be desired, no free weights. We plan to go back to Dallas in October & will probably stay somewhere different, only because I like to try new places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for AA Arena Events”
Reviews.Author: lkar
Reviews.Content: This is an extended stay hotel in a part of town that is not particularly happening, except for the fact that the American Airlines arena is just down the street. I think most of the clientelle is business travellers who are there for more than a few days, but they rent out their extra units on a nightly basis for a very very affordable rate. The units are exceptionally clean, have a full kitchen, and the parking situation is outstanding. Basically, there is a parking garage next to the hotel, with an keyed-entry on every floor so you can basically park right on your floor. It's very convenient if you have groceries or large luggage. You can come as you go as you please, and parking is free. There is no restaurant, but there is a little market where you can buy stuff to keep in your refrigerator or cook on your cooktop. There also is a better-than-I-expected buffet breakfast. The key advantage to this place is if you're going to events at American Airlines arean. The arena is a 6 minute walk if you take the short cut, and a 7 minute walk if you don't. In other words, it's very close. Several of the people staying there seemed to be folks from far away places in Texas that came for games (the mavericks and the stars play at AA) and didn't want to do the back and forth drive in one day. The price was unbelievable -- we got an AAA deal that was less than a third of the price of the fancy W hotel which is also right near the arena. It's a little hard to find from the highway, so the front desk staff seemed a bit overwhelmed at times having to be on the phone to give directions. But they were otherwise very friendly and helpful. Given the nature of the extended stay accomodations and the fact that each room has a big kitchen and stuff, housekeeping takes a while, so I got the sense that early check ins and late check outs are rare. If you're looking for a full comprehensive Dallas vacation hotel, this is probably not the place location wise. But if you want a kitchen, an actual bedroom with a door that closes off, free parking, and easy access, this is a great option. Very pleased with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean (too clean?)”
Reviews.Author: ashlib
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an Uptown Dallas wedding (and we couldn't afford uptown Dallas hotel prices). Pros included the free shuttle, a nice free breakfast buffet, internet access, friendly staff, quiet room, nice closet and bathroom, and rates. An unexpected plus was ordering pizza one day from a place recommended by the hotel, and getting one of the best pizzas we've had in a long time! Cons included location (a bit desolate, not walkable to restaurants/bars or shopping), and a smell of cleaner/disinfectant (made me think of furniture polish) in the lobby and rooms. Other reviews didn't mention this, so maybe they had just undergone a major cleaning/polishing!? All in all, we were happy with our stay and we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “IF your a runner Don't go to this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: arrowsmith
Reviews.Content: Ran the Wellstone Marathon in Dallas on Dec 2006. Upon arriving, I asked if I could stay util 1pm. There was a strict policy with staying past the checkout time of 11:00. Since I was planning to run 4 hrs marathon. This would place me at 12pm. I asked if there was any possible way. They said that there were a bunch of people arriving Sunday afternoon and that it was not possible unless I paid 1/2 cost of room. Upon completing the race, I went past the area and notice runners leaving the elevator and checkout of the hotel. This means to me that there is not equal treatment. I suspect since I not of european descent there are some discrimination with the staff. The rooms were ok. comfortable but ...

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Needs to be Replaced”
Reviews.Author: Temecula
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at the Bradford Homesuites in Downtown Dallas, for the WEFTEC convention. Checked in on Friday, hotel was nice and (appeared) clean. The people at the front desk friendly, gave us pre-printed directions (hard to read as the copies were very light, you might want to bring a map from AAA) to different resturants and shopping. Got up Saturday to take a shower and the tub did not drain. Stopped by the front desk to let them know and they informed me that maintenance would not be in until Monday, they can fix it then. Saturday night tried to use the microwave to re heat my dinner from the previous night and it did not work. Called the front desk and again they informed that the maintenance crew would not be in until Monday. Okay, I am a pretty understanding person and reliaze that there is nothing they can do. So I wait until Monday. Maintenance crew showed up Monday morning with a new microwave. Upon my leaving I stopped by the front desk to ask that housekeeping clean my tub after maintenance was done with my drainage problem, since housekeeping will only clean my room 1 time during my week stay. Upon my return on Monday afternoon, I find my tub still dirty, with the maintenance black shoe prints on the tile. I go back down stairs to the front desk and let them know that my tub is still dirty, it was nice that housekeeping made my bed and gave me fresh towels, but I really wanted my tub cleaned. They said they would have housekeeping go backup and clean it. I returned Monday night to find my tub has STILL not been cleaned. I return the front desk on Tuesday morning and let them know that this is the 3rd time that I asked for my tub to be cleaned, they assured me that they would have housekeeping clean it. Upon my return on Tuesday evening, I find that my bed has been made, fresh towls put out and dishes done, but my TUB IS STILL DIRTY!!!!!!! I call down to the front desk, and let them know that my tub was still dirty and someone needs to come up and clean it while I am here. He said that the cleaning crew was gone and he would come up and clean it himself as soon as he gets a chance. 10:30pm he came up to clean the tub himselft and said that he is not housekeeping and would do the best he can. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend for a concert at the Magnolia Theater and loved it. The room was clean and nice. It had a small kitchen with micro, full sized fridge, two electric burners and a toaster oven. Our room did NOT have a full size oven, but we ate out everyday, so it wasn't a problem. Free internet access (ethernet, so bring your own connections), free gated parking, quiet hallways. We didn't partake of the continental breakfast, so I have no opinion on that. Also didn't use the pool & hot tub, but it looked clean and well-kept. The only negative was that none of the maids on our floor spoke English, so just getting towels & pillows instead of full housekeeping service was a challenge. Eventually told the maids to NOT clean the room and went downstairs to the front desk for my towels. The front desk was very helpful and apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Will come again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at the Bradford Suites. It is conveniently located near the American Airlines Center, West End, and McKinney Ave clubs. The rooms are a bit small for suites, but they were clean and the kitchen was well appointed. The staff was consistently friendly, learned my name over the 4 days that I was there, and quickly resolved a problem with billing. All in all I was very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Accomidations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a New years trip to Dallas. We got a really good rate on hotwire for about 70.USD per night. The hotel is a good bargin all of the rooms are suites which include a mic, fridge, and even a stove. The location could be better you would have to drive or take the shuttle to downtown or uptown. The service could have been a liitle better, but all in all it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: rippowam22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, overall a very good value considering we got it on Hotwire for around $45 per night. Worth more than that if you had no other "discounted options" for sure. Positives: Great location just on the edge of downtown, a 10 minute walk from American Airlines Center. Free covered parking. Comfortable bed, quiet, good HVAC, very clean and has a small kitchen to boot. No complaints at all about the room. So-So: The continental breakfast was pretty mediocre. The usual cereal, juice, coffee and a couple of dreary hot selections (think HS Cafeteria). Their coffee cake is right out of the supermarket bakery, little taste. Only a handful of tables to eat, so not exactly a "welcoming" area if you get down there and all the tables are taken. Could be much better if a bit more attention was given. Unfortunately, the hotel insists on using Air Freshener everyday throughout each hallway. After the first day, it just became more and more annoying. We're not talking about a "spritz" here and there, I actually saw the maid walking down the hallway blasting it the WHOLE length of each corridor. Sort of like having to walk thru a Roach Motel before you get to your room (didn't affect the smell in the room). They do have two computers to use for free, with free printing, but they must cater to some local college students because it was difficult to find them open to use...no matter what time of day. But, hey, free is free! Average: Although the maid service was very good, the Front Desk was "OK", but not too friendly. The kind of folks that would answer your questions, but wouldn't exactly give you a warm welcome when you approached the desk. Not bad, just not impressed. Overall: I would absolutely stay there again, esp at the rate I got. I'd probably be willing to pay up to $70 per night if I had to. Much nicer property than your avg Candlewood Suites or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for American Airlines Center”
Reviews.Author: saqsaq
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here one night while in Dallas for a Neil Diamond concert. This is an extended stay type hotel downtown Dallas, only a 5 minute walk from the American Airlines Center, where many concerts and sporting events are held. This was a perfect location if you are attending something at the American Airlines Center as it was an easy 5 minute walk and we did not have to fight the traffic or pay the $20 parking fee at the concert venue. We had 2 double beds and a kitchen in our room. Parking was gated and covered and free! Book ahead for busy event weekends. We had to reserve through an on-line booking service to secure a room. Rate was $90 and included continental breakfast. Staff were also very helpful with dining suggestions for the area as well as providing driving directions, courtesy of mapquest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasent hotel to be in. I travel all over the place for business and I felt right at home here. They have a marketplace that you can pick up items from if you don't feel like going out, and you can even cook in your room! They provide free internet service in the room, they have laundry facilities, and the staff is extremely helpful. The rooms are clean and functional. This was the first time I have ever posted a response for a hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Bradford Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bradford Homesuites for two nights on a business trip. I had a huge suite with two comfortable double beds, a full bath, an additional sink/vanity, a living room, a kitchen, and a desk. It was clean and quiet. They left complimentary snacks each day (microwave popcorn and breakfast bars). Complimentary continental breakfast was good (muffins, toast, juice, coffee, fruit, several hot items). There is a small business center in the lobby with two computers, including free internet access and free use of the printer. There is also a free shuttle to downtown, a couple minutes away, although you need to reserve in advance. The hotel is walking distance to the arena, if you want to see a basketball game. Otherwise, there is nothing much in walking distance. The hotel is very reasonably priced. I paid $74/night.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-Off”
Reviews.Author: crtexas
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed reservation for a certain type of room, which they refused to honor. They said the would help find a similar hotel in the area, but hung up on me. They still didn't have a problem charging me the full price of the type of room that I did reserve! The breakfast was stale bagels and dognuts. The room was no better than a cheap motel, with hairs left in the bathroom and a distinct odor in the rooms and the halls. I have stayed at other Bradford's before, but have never been at one like this. Never had such rude and un-helpfull staff before, either.

Reviews.Title: “warning!”
Reviews.Author: kauai744
Reviews.Content: i arrived with a confirmed guaranteed reservation, to be told that there was no room. i was attending a conference nearby. i was accommodated (but not to my satisfaction) at a hotel approx. 6 miles away (in traffic). good luck if you stay here, you'll need it.

Reviews.Title: “What A Find!”
Reviews.Author: BRENT7
Reviews.Content: In the past when Ivisited Dallas I usually stayed at a Sheraton or a Clarion Hotel. This time I decided it was time for a change and chose the Bradford. What A find! The clean well appointed room was just right. A real home away from home. The welcome basket of goodies was a nice idea. The staff was polite and eager to answer any questions. I definitely plan to return and would recommend the Bradford to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Croomsters
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! My husband and I stayed here for a wedding and the establishment was top notch. The room was spacious, clean and new. Nice hallways, snack room, work out room and it even has a computer room. Breakfast was great and convenient as well. Gated parking lot and everything. You should never pay the high prices for the hoity toity stuff, just come here. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: ShayDe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while in town for our friends' wedding; it was one of the hotels they recommended to their wedding guests, and we're very glad we chose this one. (Guests who stayed at the pricier Hotel Lawrence had all kinds of complaints about their accommodations.) Our studio suite was very spacious, comfortable, and clean; it had separate living/dining and sleeping areas, a large bathroom, a good amount of closet/storage space, and a well-equipped kitchen. A table and chairs served as the dining/work area, and the living area had a comfortable sofa and recliner facing a TV with free expanded cable and HBO, as well as a VCR and movies-on-demand. The kitchen included a refrigerator, microwave, stove burners, toaster, coffeemaker, dishwasher, glasses, dishes, pots, and utensils. The hotel provided a "First Nighter" move-in package with coffee, microwave popcorn, a couple of NutriGrain bars, a bottle of water, etc. (It was a very welcome touch, since we arrived at the hotel after 11pm and had a serious case of the munchies.) The bed was comfortable, the towels and linens were clean and in good shape, and mini soaps and shampoo were provided (which isn't always the case with extended-stay hotels). We had a special wedding guest rate of $69/night (AAA members can get the same discount rate). The rate included free secured parking, free local calls, and a pretty decent free continental breakfast. Guests staying less than seven days pay a per-night rate instead of the more economical weekly rate, so daily "freshen-up" housekeeping service was also included in our rate. The hotel also offers a pool, spa, fitness center, and business center with high-speed Internet access. To top it all off, our room (which faced Harry Hines Blvd.) happened to have a pretty nice view of the Dallas skyline. We highly recommend this hotel - it was a great value for the price - and we would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: HYATT house Dallas/Uptown
HotelInfo.Address: 2914 Harry Hines Boulevard, Dallas, TX 75201 (Formerly Hyatt Summerfield Suites Dallas/Uptown)
